name: European Coalition to End Animal Experiments
goal: The European Coalition to End Animal Experiments (ECEAE) is an umbrella organisation of currently 15 member and 4 observer animal protection and anti-vivisection organisations across Europe. It’s goal is to end animal experiments in Europe on ethical and scientific grounds.
interests: Environment, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
As the leading umbrella organization specialised in the area of animal experiments the ECEAE has stakeholder status with official EU bodies which intersect with animal experiments:
- ECHA (European Chemicals Agency) Member State Committee (MCS)
- National Contact Point (NCP) of the Member States on the Directive 2010/63/EU
- CARACAL - Competent Authorities for REACH and CLP (Classification, Labelling and Packaging of Substances)
- ECVAM (European Centre for the Validation of Alternative Methods)
